2019.title: Ghidra
2019.description: Ghidra is NSA‑developed open‑source reverse engineering framework released in March 2019 at RSA. Supports decompilation, collaboration on Windows, macOS, Linux.

2019.title: Sigstore
2019.description: Sigstore, launched in 2019 by Google/RedHat/Linux Foundation, is an open‑source code‑signing solution to secure software supply chains with transparent public logs.

2019.title: Semgrep
2019.description: Semgrep (open‑source static analysis tool), officially released in February 2020, is built on foundational work from 2019 and earlier sgrep, offering customizable rule‑based code scanning.

2019.title: Keystone
2019.description: Keystone, released July 2019, is an open‑source framework for building Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) on RISC‑V hardware.

2019.title: PTHelper
2019.description: PTHelper, introduced in mid‑2024 from academic work stemming in 2019, is a modular open‑source tool to automate penetration testing workflows.
